utterances: And one day there were just four women sitting there, and we decided, `Let's move forward.
And we--Bernice taught us that song, ""Sweet Honey in the Rock.
Mm-hmm, and--been singing it ever since.
Has there ever been any consideration all those years to inviting men or other people to join the group?
But, you know, they had their chance.
You know, I always like to mention that there's a--one of the gentlemen who were one of the--you know, in the original rehearsal...

...ensemble, Mike Hodge(ph)--he has a chapter in Sweet Honey's autobiography, ""We Who Believe in Freedom,"" that talks about him being, you know, one of the first members of Sweet Honey in the Rock, and people just can't believe it.
But, you know, he's a singer and he was with us, so we say he's an old Sweet Honey.
Let's get another caller on the line, and this is Cherylee, Cherylee calling from Cleveland, Ohio.
...Louise Robinson--you know, it's funny, the metaphor that gentleman out there in the Midwest made about the name of Sweet Honey in the Rock.

Yes, it is a warm core of sweet honey, and in my own experience with Sweet Honey in the Rock, it's always been a nurturing spirit, so I thought that Carol and Louise and you, too, Ysaye, who have been a nurturing spirit to me, would love to know that my daughter Beth has just had her first baby.
And they're down in Raleigh, North Carolina.
And Erica Elizabeth McRae(ph) will be one year old on Thanksgiving Day.
And I was wondering if you could suggest which album I should send Beth to take her--spring her through her first year of motherhood.
Oh, ""Still the Same Me."" You can do--What's the other one?
I Got Shoes, You Got Shoes."" Cheryl, that is so great.
I'll have to find some way to get in touch with you, Maillard.
I know I have your e-mail somewhere around.
Girl, go to the Web site.
Go to SweetHoney.com, and say that you're--you know, that we know who you are and you're trying to reach us.
It's a blessing a to hear from you.
Ty(ph) has the main--I think the main e-mail.
I'm sorry, people, for doing this, but...
Cheryl was a member of the DC Black Repertory Company.
She was one of the original members of the company.
And she was in Bernice's workshop, too.
